summary: This is an email chain forwarded by attorney Stacey Richman, containing threatening messages sent to Mark L. Epstein. The messages, from an individual using the alias 'Puggie', reference the recipient's brother, imply his death was a killing, and threaten further violence against the recipient's family to influence court testimony.

events.title: Threatening Emails Sent to Mark L. Epstein
events.description: An individual using the alias 'Puggie' sends a series of emails to Mark L. Epstein threatening to kill his family and referencing his brother's death as a killing, in an attempt to coerce his court testimony.

events.title: Death of Mark L. Epstein's Brother
events.description: Referenced in the threats as a past event where the brother was killed, allegedly because 'he wanted to tell the court everything.'

events.title: Pending Court Proceedings Involving Mark L. Epstein
events.description: Implied by the threats which aim to influence whether Epstein tells the court he 'partnered with your brother'.

keyFacts: Threatening emails were sent to Mark L. Epstein on May 25, 2020, attempting to coerce his court testimony by threatening his family.
The threats reference the death of Mark L. Epstein's brother, implying it was a killing because he 'wanted to tell the court everything.'
The sender uses the alias 'Puggie' and references an unnamed 'boss' who wants to meet Epstein.
Attorney Stacey Richman forwarded this email chain, indicating legal involvement and the serious nature of the threats.
